title: Drawing, "Design for ceiling decoration"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d and 457e)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. A rinceau decorates the arch at left. Two children sit upon its base. view of a coffered vault and the molded frame of an oblong panel in the center. At the base of the vault is a pointed one with a semicircular painting of buildings. Two children sit beside it.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for ceiling decoration".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1532.
